H0.text: Chordates are the only animal phyla that do not consist exclusively of invertebrates.

H1.text: Arthropods are the only animal phyla that does not consist exclusively of invertebrates.

H2.text: Bacteria is the only animal phylum that does not consist exclusively of invertebrates.

H3.text: Eukaryotes are the only animal phyla that do not consist exclusively of invertebrates.

A4.text: Vertebrates are a subphylum of chordates, and vertebrates are animals with backbones (which are not invertebrates).
